solution.text:
The two digit number be represented as 10x+y where x is the tens place and y is the units place of the number.
The difference between the digits is _{j}_
y-x=_{j}_
y=_{j}_+x
Therefore,the number 10x+y=10x+_{j}_+x
11x+_{j}_ and
the reverse number 10y+x=10(_{j}_+x)+x
Hence, 11x+_{{10*j}}_
The sum of the two numbers is _{{33*j}}_
Therefore, 11x+_{j}_+11x+_{{10*j}}_=_{{33*j}}_
22x+_{{11*j}}_=_{{33*j}}_
22x=_{{22*j}}_
x=_{j}_
y=_{{2*j}}_
\( \Rightarrow \) The number is _{{10*j}}_+_{{2*j}}_=_{{12*j}}_

content.text: The digits of a two digit number differ such that the ones place digit is _{j}_ more than the tens digit If the digits are interchanged and the resulting number is added to the original number ,we get _{{33*j}}_ . What can be the original number?
